verses.roman:
sumitrārjunapālādīn
samīkāt tu sudāmanī
ānakaḥ karṇikāyāṁ vai
ṛtadhāmā-jayāv api

synonyms: sumitra—Sumitra; arjunapāla—Arjunapāla; ādīn—headed by; samīkāt—from King Śamīka; tu—indeed; sudāmanī—in the womb of Sudāmanī, his wife; ānakaḥ—King Ānaka; karṇikāyām—in the womb of his wife Karṇikā; vai—indeed; ṛtadhāmā—Ṛtadhāmā; jayau—and Jaya; api—indeed.
translation: From Śamīka, by the womb of his wife, Sudāmanī, came Sumitra, Arjunapāla and other sons. King Ānaka, by his wife, Karṇikā, begot two sons, namely Ṛtadhāmā and Jaya.
